definition: fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
wheel/disk/ring/steamship/to take turns/to rotate/by turn/classifier for big round objects: disk, or recurring events: round, turn

(martial arts) wind-and-fire wheel, weapon used in hand-to-hand fighting/(Daoism) a magical pair of wheels on which one can stand to ride at great speed, used by Nezha 哪吒[Ne2 zha5]/(fig.) never-ending treadmill

sentences.english: Spun the wheel and have instant flame.
sentences.chinese: 旋動火輪，火焰馬上就會燃燒。

sentences.english: A rubber wheel spins the flint and sparks flame.
sentences.chinese: 一個橡皮輪旋轉火輪打出火星。

sentences.english: Driving on fiery wings to Nature's throne.
sentences.chinese: 駕着火輪向造化的寶座奔突。

sentences.english: Bicycle sense of shock color gas nozzle lights, Hot Wheels, lights.
sentences.chinese: 自行車感震變色氣嘴燈，風火輪，車燈。

sentences.english: We were scheduled to go to Guangzhou by steam boat.
Do you want to design your own cool Hot Wheels car?
sentences.chinese: 你想自己設計一款很酷的風火輪賽車嗎？

to have an audience (with the Emperor)
luan and phoenix/husband and wife/virtuous person/sovereign/belle
Guoxing or Kuohsing township in Nantou county 南投縣|南投县[Nan2 tou2 xian4], central Taiwan
to spin a web (spider)/to weave a net (e.g. for fishing)
